physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Hypotonia, weakness, delayed motor and intellectual milestones, short stature, obesity, mental retardation, short fifth metacarpals, asymmetry of the legs (right leg 1.5 cm longer), semiptosis of the left eyelid, hyporeflexia, kyphoscoliosis, limited neck flexion, hip girdle weakness, waddling gait, Gowers' sign, elevated rT3 levels, bilateral sensorineural loss (45 dB right, 40 dB left ear), analysis showed normal serum creatine kinase and aldolase, and a normal karyotype (46,XX).
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: At age 11, slightly elevated TSH levels since age 11 months, with high T4 and low T3, thyroid hormone level abnormalities persisted throughout childhood. Progressive peripheral sensitive neuropathy was diagnosed at age 9. Although selenium supplementation normalized serum selenium and glutathione peroxidase levels, selenoprotein P levels remained undetectable, and thyroid hormone dysfunction was not corrected. Marked hypotrophy of thigh muscle was noted at age 12.
